content: easy no-sew octopus crochet pattern this easy no-sew pattern is based on the original danish octo project octopus pattern i have made adjustments in terms of hook size round count and the attaching of the tentacles so that it would be easier to make and safer for the preemies if you are making it as a gift for someone who is not a preemie or a newborn feel free to use other types of yarn and hook sizes selling this pattern is strictly prohibited as its primary purpose is one of medical aid for prematurely born children if you need any help with the pattern feel free to contact me via instagram or tiktok @miluswonderland difficulty level beginner terminology this pattern uses us terminology below you can find the abbreviation you will need  chain - chain  magic_ring magic_ring  single_crochet single_crochet  increase increase  decrease decrease  fpsc front post single_crochet  double_crochet double_crochet  slsl slip_stitch materials used  cotton yarn 100 percent cotton only cotton 8/4 or 8/8 the reason for mentioning more options is that tightness is individual and to emphasize that it is perfectly fine to use leftover yarn the octos does not have to be all alike though preferably not larger than the one on the picture below and smaller would be great less than one skein  some black cotton yarn for embroidering the face or any other color optional  2mm crochet hook 2 5mm crochet hook  sewing needle  scissors  stitch markers i used a piece of yarn in another color  acrylic fiber for stuffing has to be washable at 60 degrees celsius 140 degrees fahrenheit the tentacles shouldn t be more than 22cm in length fully stretched this is for the purpose of safety of newborns and preemies the head start with 2mm hook working in continuous rounds 1 6 single_crochet in magic_ring 6 - i used a piece of yarn in another color as a stitch marker here and placed it on the 1st stitch of each round 2 6 increase 12 3 single_crochet increase x6 18 4 single_crochet increase 2sc increase x5 single_crochet 24 5 3sc increase x6 30 6 2sc increase 4sc increase x5 2sc 36 7 5sc increase x6 42 8-15 42 single_crochet 8 rounds 16 5sc decrease x6 36 17-18 36sc 2 rounds 19 2sc decrease 4sc decrease x5 2sc 30 20-21 30 single_crochet 2 rounds 22 3sc decrease x6 24 23-24 24 single_crochet 2 rounds start stuffing the head along the way it needs to be stuffed firmly 25 single_crochet decrease 2sc decrease x5 single_crochet 18 26 18sc 18 27 7sc decrease x2 16 28 16 single_crochet 16 finish stuffing the head now we start working on the tentacles fpsc chain 50 starting from the 2nd chain from the hook make 2sc in each chain until the end fpsc on the next stitch in round 25 to attach the tentacle x8 when you have finished all the tentacles make
